alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range and Adjacent High Plains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 20 at 1:26PM MDT until October 20 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING UNTIL 7 PM FOR FWZS 418...419...429... 430... 431...432...433...436 AND 437... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR MOST LOCATIONS IN SOUTHEAST WYOMING AND THE NEBRASKA PANHANDLE FRIDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 419... * WIND...Strong west to northwest winds gusting 35 to 40 mph * HUMIDITY...Afternoon humidity 10 to 15 percent. * HAINES...4 to 5 * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: North Laramie Range and Adjacent High Plains
